moves.1. d4:
I've been having success in my GK Advance sections and I've won my last 3 first rounds in this tournament; however, somewhere during this time frame my rating bounced above 1700 for a moment and I got knocked up to the "Expert" section.

In the last Expert Section I played at GK I scored a "0" (also a second round bounce up). This time I was determined to score better (sheesh). In the end, I scored a 3.5 and this game features my highest draw aginst any GK opponent.
moves.1... d5 2. Bg5: I wanted to play solid but also be out of book. I'm not sure what this opening is but felt as though it was the best of both worlds.
moves.2... h6 3. Bh4 c6 4. Nf3 Qb6 5. Qc1 Bf5: He has committed to the advance of the kingside which means he must be getting ready to castle queenside. I didn't feel any panic from this pawn rush and proceeded to play solidly.
moves.11. Bg3 Nh5: I don't think this is the best move. Maybe h5 is better?
moves.12. c4: Since he has to castle queenside (I think), I wanted to open QS-files.
I'm looking to double on the C-file, and I kept examining e6 pushes although I couldn't find a shot.
moves.19... hxg2 20. Rfc1 O-O-O 21. Nb5: The computer didn't like this move although I thought it was pretty clever. I wanted to embed my knight on d6 and at the very least trade knight for bishop.
moves.21... Rh6 22. Kxg2: I had to take here since the Rh6 move protects the invasion but also prepares to double on the h-file.
moves.25... Kb8 26. Nf5: I wondered whether I was overworking my queen since it would leave the b2 pawn unprotected; however, I figured taking the bpawn would only open up another half file to his king and i would have targets on his kingside.
moves.26... Re6: The attack on the pawn is a waste of time in my view. I think he should have taken with the bishop.
moves.28... g4 29. e6 Rd8: I kept examing Q to f6 but realized the Rook at d8 was still protected.
moves.30. Bxg4 Bxe6 31. Bxe6 fxe6: Okay...I have to be winning now, right? My g pawn is ready to run and all of his pawns will have to face resistence.
moves.32. Qc5: First things first...force the trade of queens to consolidate the position.
moves.32... Qxc5 33. Rxc5 Kc7 34. Kg2 b6 35. R: I know he can make a passer now....feeling ambivalent about the position.
moves.41. f4: I offered a draw here...he didn't accept. I saw that the passer he could make would be an isolated. I thought that presented an extra target.
moves.41... c3 42. Rc1 Rc7 43. bxc3 bxc3 44. K: This move has a tripple purpose. 1) To move toward the pawn on C3; 2) To clear the file so the rook can get to h2 and; 3) To advance to support the g-passer.
moves.44... Rb8 45. Rh2 Rb2 46. Rg2: You know, I thought this move was quite clever since it prepares the push of the G-pawn and forces the exchance and thereby forces the C-pawn to remain isolated. The computer preferred Rc1 to Rc2. So I guess I wasn't so clever.
moves.46... Rxg2 47. Kxg2 a4 48. Kf3: Again with the dual purpose of advancing to support G or to win the C pawn.
moves.49... e5 50. fxe5+: I thought a long time of pushing the pawn to f5 but I couldn't get it to hold up in analysis. Although I'm winning, the g is isolated and will fall.
moves.50... Kxe5 51. Kd3: I already see the finish where the other pawns will come off the board and I'm going to have a R and pawn (A-pawn) versus Rook ending. I still hoped I could squeeze a win, but now I wasn't sure.
moves.51... Rg7 52. Rxc3:
I offered a draw and he accepted. I know the rule that in rook versus rook and pawn endings that if the king can get to the queening square it is a draw and so since his king is in position to get to A8 and I would have to untangle, I figured I'd take the points. Maybe I should have played on for another 20 moves to see what happened, but I didn't have much of a plan other than to move the rook to A6 boxing in his king but I really didn't see how I could bring my king into play assumintg he placed his rook at g4.

Still, I got my highest draw on GK. I'll take it. Hopefully I will be back in the Advance sections in the future. These Experts are killers and this is coming from a Class A USCF OTB player.
